page.title: 11Clubs in Norham
page.content: Recreational activity in the rural community is almost totally dependant on voluntary organisations.Small committees emerge to form meetings, competitions and social outings amongst their own members or between similar groups in outlying areas. All age groups are well catered for. There is a mums/toddler group for pre-school children. Older children are geared towards brownies, beavers and cubs, as well as a roller-skating club and a youth club. Adults might choose the Womens Institute, over 60's, carpet bowls, bridge, billiards, embroidery group and a Scottish country dancing group. These all meet regularly throughout the year in either the village hall or one of the two church halls nearby. Additional organisations meet in one of the two public houses.
